sections.name: Tripkee Fiend Keeper
sections.text: Tripkees have a technique for dealing with unholy threats that has been passed down through the generations. A fiend keeper can absorb unholy spirits into their body before those entities can cause trouble for their kin. Though they can tap into this power when necessary, tripkee fiend keepers try to cleanse themselves of its evil influence by undertaking good deeds.

sections.name: Tripkee
sections.text: Traditionally making their homes in the treetops of tropical jungles and forests, these frog-like humanoids are often seen as resourceful and cautious, preferring to live and hunt hidden in the branches of tall trees.

traits.name: Humanoid
traits.text: Humanoid creatures reason and act much like humans. They typically stand upright and have two arms and two legs.

traits.name: Tripkee
traits.text: A creature with this trait is a member of the tripkee ancestry. Tripkees are a family of froglike humanoids. An ability with this trait can be used or selected only by tripkees. An item with this trait is created and used by tripkees.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text: Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Shove
traits.text: You can use this weapon to Shove with the Athletics skill even if you don’t have a free hand. This uses the weapon’s reach (if different from your own) and adds the weapon’s item bonus to attack rolls as an item bonus to the Athletics check. If you critically fail a check to Shove using the weapon, you can drop the weapon to take the effects of a failure instead of a critical failure.

traits.name: Agile
traits.text: The multiple attack penalty you take with this weapon on the second attack on your turn is –4 instead of –5, and –8 instead of –10 on the third and subsequent attacks in the turn.

traits.name: Finesse
traits.text: You can use your Dexterity modifier instead of your Strength modifier on attack rolls using this melee weapon. You still calculate damage using Strength.

traits.name: Nonlethal
traits.text: Attacks with this weapon are nonlethal, and are used to knock creatures unconscious instead of kill them. You can use a nonlethal weapon to make a lethal attack with a –2 circumstance penalty.

traits.name: Magical
traits.text: Something with the magical trait is imbued with magical energies not tied to a specific tradition of magic. Some items or effects are closely tied to a particular tradition of magic. In these cases, the item has the arcane, divine, occult, or primal trait instead of the magical trait. Any of these traits indicate that the item is magical.

traits.name: Thrown
traits.text: You can throw this weapon as a ranged attack; it is a ranged weapon when thrown. You add your Strength modifier to damage as you would for a melee weapon. When this trait appears on a melee weapon, it also includes the range increment. Ranged weapons with this trait use the range increment in the weapon’s Range entry.

ability.name: Bounce Cruuk
ability.text: The tripkee fiend keeper makes a ranged Strike with their cruuk against a target within 30 feet. Once the Strike is complete, the cruuk ricochets back into the tripkee fiend keeper's hand. If their hands are full when the cruuk returns, it falls to the ground in their space.

ability.name: Forest Passage
ability.text: The tripkee ignores difficult terrain caused by plants, such as bushes, vines, and undergrowth.

ability.name: Harness Wickedness

traits.name: Concentrate
traits.text: An action with this trait requires a degree of mental concentration and discipline.

traits.name: Divine
traits.text:
This magic comes from the divine tradition, drawing power from deities or similar sources. Anything with this trait is magical.  
  
A creature with this trait is primarily constituted of or has a strong connection to divine magic.

traits.name: Unholy
traits.text: Effects with the unholy trait are tied to powerful magical forces of cruelty and sin. They often have stronger effects on holy creatures. Creatures with this trait are strongly devoted to unholy causes, and often have weakness to holy. If a creature with weakness to unholy uses an unholy item or effect, it takes damage from its weakness.

ability.requirement: The tripkee fiend keeper isn't stupefied
ability.effect: The tripkee fiend keeper allows a portion of the fiendish power they have absorbed to flow through their body. For the next minute, the tripkee fiend keeper's Strikes deal an additional die of damage and gain the unholy trait. The tripkee fiend keeper also gains 10 temporary Hit Points, a +5- foot status bonus to Speed for the duration, and weakness 5 to holy. At the end of the duration, the tripkee fiend keeper is stupefied 1 for 1 hour.

ability.name: Hunter of Virtue
ability.text: Whenever the tripkee fiend keeper critically hits an unholy creature, they reduce the value of their stupefied condition by 1.
